channel.title: Setting up on linux
channel.description:
Ok, I have tried a quite alot of ways using Trial and Error, nowhere so far. I think i have my sh linux files set up correctly to run the server only problem is, it's different to demonik since that runs off a build folder.. Rscd runs off the .jar? And i'm pretty confused on how this all works.. Anybody with experience with linux feel like giving a helping hand? If your not going to help or you are going to say oh it's easy.. Don't post at all.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Setting up on linux
item.dc:creator: @BuyMyJunk BuyMyJunk
item.description:
@BuyMyJunk wrote:

[quote=“freaky5000, post:6, topic:225219”]Lol, cheers for that mate, it’s my last day in england for 2 weeks going on holiday couple mates wanted to have a drink with me, had abit too much lol. I’m going to have a loook at this what does it do exactly? Set up a build file instead of rscd.jar?

You got msn?[/quote]
it just makes the build folder, and then runs the loginserver and the server it self from the build folder, other then the jar file
it goes in this order with the other build file
build folder —> compile to build/org or build/com —> make rscd.jar —> delete build folder

with this new build file it does
make build folder —> compile files to building/org or build/com

it just like what demonik did

Read full topic

item.title: Setting up on linux
item.dc:creator: @BuyMyJunk BuyMyJunk
item.description:
@BuyMyJunk wrote:

not sure if this is what you want but anyway here

open the build.xml, and replase the compile part with this
it will make the build folder and stop, not delete it or make the jar

<target name="compile"> <mkdir dir="${build}" /> <javac srcdir="${src}" destdir="${build}" debug="on" target="1.5"> <classpath> <pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" /> <pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" /> <pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar"/> <pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar"/> <pathelement location="${lib}/mysql-connector.jar" /> <pathelement location="${lib}/hex-string.jar" /> <pathelement location="${lib}/jmf.jar" /> <pathelement path="${java.class.path}/"/> </classpath> </javac> </target>

then you will need to look for, this makes it read from the jar file, which we dont want

<pathelement path="${jar}/" />

replace it with this makign it read from build folder other then the jar file

<pathelement path="${build}/" />

if you can figure it out here is the whole file

[code]

<property name="src" location="src" />
<property name="build" location="build" />
<property name="doc" location="../doc" />
<property name="lib" location="lib" />
<property name="settings" location="settings.ini" />

<target name="compile">

	<mkdir dir="${build}" />
	<javac srcdir="${src}" destdir="${build}" debug="on" target="1.5">
	  <classpath>
		<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar"/>
		<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar"/>
		<pathelement location="${lib}/mysql-connector.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/hex-string.jar" />
		<pathelement location="${lib}/jmf.jar" />
		<pathelement path="${java.class.path}/"/>
	  </classpath>
	</javac>
</target>

<target name="doc" depends="compile">
	<javadoc sourcepath="${src}" destdir="${doc}" verbose="on" />
</target>

<target name="map">
	<java classname="org.rscdaemon.server.util.MapGenerator" fork="true">
		<jvmarg value="-Xms128m" />
		<jvmarg value="-Xmx512m" />
		<arg value="map.png" />
		<arg value="${world}.conf" />
		<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mysql-connector.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/hex-string.jar" />
			<pathelement path="${build}/" />
		</classpath>
	</java>
</target>

<target name="runls">
	<java classname="org.rscdaemon.ls.Server" fork="true">
		<jvmarg value="-Xms128m" />
		<jvmarg value="-Xmx512m" />
		<arg value="ls.conf" />
		<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mysql-connector.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/hex-string.jar" />
			<pathelement path="${build}/" />
		</classpath>
	</java>
</target>

<target name="runserver">
	<java classname="org.rscdaemon.server.Server" fork="true">
		<jvmarg value="-Xms128m" />
		<jvmarg value="-Xmx512m" />
		<arg value="world.xml" />
		<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mysql-connector.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/hex-string.jar" />
			<pathelement location="quests/" />
			<pathelement path="${build}/" />
		</classpath>
	</java>
</target>

<target name="runclient">
	<java classname="org.rscdaemon.client.mudclient" fork="true">
		<jvmarg value="-Xms128m" />
		<jvmarg value="-Xmx512m" />
		<arg value="${settings}" />
		<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mysql-connector.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/hex-string.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/jmf.jar" />
			<pathelement path="${build}/" />
		</classpath>
	</java>
</target>

<target name="runspriteeditor">
	<java classname="org.rscdaemon.spriteeditor.SpriteEditor" fork="true">
		<jvmarg value="-Xms128m" />
		<jvmarg value="-Xmx512m" />
		<classpath>
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mina.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xpp3.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/slf4j.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/xstream.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/mysql-connector.jar" />
			<pathelement location="${lib}/hex-string.jar" />
			<pathelement path="${build}/" />
		</classpath>
	</java>
</target>
[/code]

Read full topic
